cogs.name: General
cogs.short_help: Commands that don't really fit into the other categories
cogs.help:
Commands that don't really fit into the other categories

Random and/or fun commands with a variety of uses

cogs.name: Audio
cogs.short_help: For playing audio in a voice channel
cogs.help:
For playing audio in a voice channel

For dota-related audio commands, try `{cmdpfx}help dotabase`

cogs.name: Dotabase
cogs.short_help: For information about Dota 2, and playing hero responses
cogs.help:
For information about Dota 2, and playing hero responses

Interfaces with [dotabase](http://github.com/mdiller/dotabase). Check out [dotabase.dillerm.io](http://dotabase.dillerm.io) if you want to see a website that interfaces with dotabase.

cogs.name: DotaStats
cogs.short_help: Commands for displaying information about Dota 2 players and matches
cogs.help:
Commands for displaying information about Dota 2 players and matches

Most of the data for this is collected through the [OpenDota API](https://docs.opendota.com/)

cogs.name: Pokemon
cogs.help:
Pokemon related commands

A few commands using the [pokeapi](https://pokeapi.co/) which provides information about pokemon

Note that the above API does not include information about pokemon Sun and Moon, so I can't look up those pokemon for you

cogs.name: Artifact
cogs.help:
Artifact related commands

A few commands providing information about Valve's new game [Artifact](https://playartifact.com)

cogs.name: Admin
cogs.short_help: Commands to help manage mangobyte on your server/guild
cogs.help:
Commands to help manage mangobyte on your server/guild

Primarily used to stop people from ruining stuff, and to configure mangobyte to do different things.

Only admins or people with the correct role can use these commands. To set a role as the 'Bot Admin' role, try `{cmdpfx}config botadmin`

commands.name: abilities
commands.short_help: Shows all of the abilities/spells for that hero
commands.help: Shows all of the abilities/spells for that hero

commands.name: ability
commands.short_help: Gets information about a specific hero ability
commands.help:
Gets information about a specific hero ability

**Examples:**
​`/ability rocket flare`
​`/ability laser`
​`/ability sprout`

commands.name: addemoticon
commands.short_help: Adds a dota emoticon as an animated emoji
commands.help:
Adds a dota emoticon as an animated emoji

This command will add the dota emoticon as an animated emoji to the server. Because it is an animated emoji, only discord nitro users will be able to use it.

Obviously, this command needs the 'Manage Emoji' permission to be able to work.

<a:pup:406270527766790145> <a:stunned:406274986769252353> <a:cocky:406274999951949835>

**Examples:**
​`/addemoticon pup`
​`/addemoticon stunned`
​`/addemoticon naga_song`

commands.name: aghanim
commands.short_help: Gets the aghs upgrade for the given hero or ability
commands.help:
Gets the aghs upgrade for the given hero or ability

This command will get the information about shard upgrades AND scepter upgrades.
If you want just shard or just scepter upgrades, try using `/scepter` or `/shard`

commands.short_help: Answers any question you might have
commands.help: Answers any question you might have

commands.name: blog

commands.help: Pulls the newest blog post for Dota 2

commands.short_help: Gets a rough changelog for mangobyte. Note that this is just the last few commit messages.
commands.help: Gets a rough changelog for mangobyte. Note that this is just the last few commit messages.

commands.name: bot donate
commands.short_help: Posts some links with info about how to donate to the developer
commands.help: Posts some links with info about how to donate to the developer

commands.name: bot info
commands.short_help: Prints info about mangobyte
commands.help: Prints info about mangobyte

commands.name: bot invite
commands.short_help: Shows the invite link
commands.help: Shows the invite link

commands.name: bot stats
commands.short_help: Displays some bot statistics
commands.help: Displays some bot statistics

commands.short_help: Bans the user from using commands
commands.help: Bans the user from using commands

commands.name: botunban
commands.short_help: Unbans the user, allowing them to use commands
commands.help: Unbans the user, allowing them to use commands

commands.name: card
commands.short_help: Displays info about the artifact card
commands.help:
Displays info about the artifact card

Example:
​`/artifact Healing Salve`
​`/artifact Prowler Vanguard`
​`/artifact keefe`

commands.name: chatwheel
commands.short_help: Plays the given chat wheel sound
commands.help:
Plays the given chat wheel sound

Give the command a number between 1 and 22 to page through all of the available chat options:
​`/chatwheel 1`
​`/chatwheel 3`

**Examples:**
​`/chatwheel Lakad Matataaaag!`
​`/chatwheel disastah`
​`/chatwheel Wan Bu Liao La`
​`/chatwheel 玩不了啦`
​`/chatwheel ehto gg`
​`/chatwheel Это ГГ`

commands.name: clipinfo
commands.short_help: Gets information and a file for the given clip
commands.help:
Gets information and a file for the given clip

Not giving a clipid will print info about the last clip played

clipid is specified like this:
​`local:shitpickle`
​`dota:shredder_timb_ally_01`

commands.name: clips
commands.short_help: Lists the local audio clips available for the play command
commands.help:
Lists the local audio clips available for the play command

Calling this command with no arguments gets you a list of all of the clips

To get the clips that have a specific tag, do `/clips <tag>`

To get a list of all of the possible clip tags, try `/clips tags`

You can also do `/clips new` to get the 10 newest clips

commands.name: config
commands.short_help: Configures the bot's settings for this server
commands.help:
Configures the bot's settings for this server

Below are the different settings that you can tweak to customize mangobyte for this server. You can get more information about a setting by typing `/config <settingname>`, and you can configure a setting by typing `/config <settingname> <value>`

**Settings:**
​`prefix`
​`reactions`
​`ttschannel`
​`botadmin`
​`intros`
​`outros`
​`ttslang`
​`usenickname`
​`simpletts`
​`announcetts`
​`dotapatchchannel`
​`dotablogchannel`
​`ttschannelwarn`
​`allowedbots`
​`allowwebhooks`

**Examples**
​`/config prefix !`
​`/config reactions enable`
​`/config ttschannel #tts`
​`/config botadmin @BotAdmin`
​`/config intros disable`
​`/config outros disable`
​`/config ttslang Russian`
​`/config usenickname enable`
​`/config simpletts enable`
​`/config announcetts enable`
​`/config dotapatchchannel #dota`
​`/config dotablogchannel #dota`
​`/config ttschannelwarn disable`
​`/config allowedbots add @Bot123`
​`/config allowwebhooks enable`

commands.name: courage
commands.short_help: Generates a challenge build
commands.help:
Generates a challenge build

Creates a challenge build with a random (or given) hero and a random set of items

**Examples:**
​`/courage`
​`/courage shadow fiend`

commands.name: deck
commands.short_help: Displays the card list for the given deck
commands.help:
Displays the card list for the given deck

Example:
​`/deck ADCJWkTZX05uwGDCRV4XQGy3QGLmqUBg4GQJgGLGgO7AaABR3JlZW4vQmxhY2sgRXhhbXBsZQ__`

commands.name: disablecommand
commands.short_help: Disabled the specified command or command category
commands.help:
Disabled the specified command or command category

**Examples:**
​`/disablecommand wiki`
​`/disablecommand Audio`

commands.name: docs
commands.short_help: Shows some documentation about a specific part of the bot
commands.help: Shows some documentation about a specific part of the bot

commands.name: dota
commands.short_help: Plays a dota response
commands.help:
Plays a dota response

First tries to match the keyphrase with the name of a response

If there is no response matching the input string, searches for any response that has the input string as part of its text

To specify a specific hero to search for responses for, use ';' before the hero's name like this:
​`/dota ;rubick`

To specify a specific criteria to search for responses for, use ';' before the criteria name like this:
​`/dota ;rubick ;defeat`
There are some aliases for heroes, so the following will work:
​`/dota sf`
​`/dota furion`
​`/dota shredder`

If failing all of the above, the command will also try to find unlabeled heroes and critera. try:
​`/dota juggernaut bottling`
A few critera you can use are: kill, bottling, cooldown, acknowledge, immortality, nomana, and select

To search for a response without asking mangobyte, try using the [Response Searcher](http://dotabase.dillerm.io/responses/)
ProTip: If you click the discord button next to the response in the above web app, it will copy to your clipboard in the format needed to play using the bot.

commands.name: dotagif
commands.short_help: Creates a gif of a specific part of a dota match
commands.help:
Creates a gif of a specific part of a dota match

The part of the match that you specify must be less than 10 minutes long

​`ms_per_second` is how many miliseconds between frames of the gif (each frame is 1 dota second)

**Example:**
​`/dotagif 3370877768 28:37 30:30`

commands.name: echo
commands.short_help: Echos the given message
commands.help: Echos the given message

commands.name: emoticon
commands.short_help: Gets the gif of a dota emoticon
commands.help:
Gets the gif of a dota emoticon

<a:pup:406270527766790145> <a:stunned:406274986769252353> <a:cocky:406274999951949835>

**Examples:**
​`/emoticon pup`
​`/emoticon stunned`
​`/emoticon naga_song`

commands.short_help: Re-enables the specified command or command category
commands.help:
Re-enables the specified command or command category

Only works on commands that have already been disabled by the `/disablecommand` command

**Examples:**
​`/enablecommand wiki`
​`/enablecommand Audio`

commands.short_help: Gets info about the player's first dota game

Gets info about the player's first dota game

To see how to filter for specific matches, try `/docs matchfilter`

commands.help:
See what would happen if you fused two heroes together

If no heroes are given, two will be chosen at random

**Example:**
​`/fuseheroes axe chen`

commands.name: hello
commands.short_help: Says hello

Says hello

WHAT MORE DO YOU NEED TO KNOW!?!?!? IS 'Says hello' REALLY NOT CLEAR ENOUGH FOR YOU!?!!11?!!?11!!?!??

commands.short_help: Shows this message
commands.help: Shows this message

commands.help:
Gets information about a specific hero

You can give this command almost any variant of the hero's name, or the hero's id

**Examples:**
​`/hero sf`
​`/hero inker`
​`/hero furi`

commands.name: herotable
commands.short_help: Displays a sorted table of heroes and their stats
commands.help:
Displays a sorted table of heroes and their stats

Displays a table with computed hero stats showing which heroes have the highest values for the specified stat. To see the list of possible stats, try the `/leveledstats` command

**Examples:**
​`/herotable dps`
​`/herotable health lvl 30`
​`/herotable attack speed level 21 descending`

commands.short_help: Gets a nice insult for ya
commands.help:
Gets a nice insult for ya

Mention someone in discord and I'll insult them instead of you

**Example:**
​`/insult`
​`/insult @InnocentMan`

commands.help:
WOW I WONDER WAT THIS DOES

commands.name: match
commands.short_help: Gets a summary of the dota match with the given id
commands.help: Gets a summary of the dota match with the given id

commands.name: matches
commands.short_help: Gets a list of your matches
commands.help:
Gets a list of your matches

The date/time is localized based off of the server that the game was played on, which means it may not match your timezone.

To see how to filter for specific matches, try `/docs matchfilter`

Note that you can have this show up to 100 matches, but will by default only show 10, unless a timespan is given

**Example:**
​`/matches @PlayerPerson mid witch doctor ranked`
​`/matches natures prophet`
​`/matches @PlayerPerson riki`

commands.name: matchgraph
commands.short_help: Creates a graph for a dota match
commands.help:
Creates a graph for a dota match

Give this match a match_id or it will try to use your last played game

different types of graphs:
teamdiff: creates a graph of the networth/xp differences between the teams
playergold: creates a graph of the networths of the players throughout the match
(ill probably add more in the futre but thats it for now)

commands.name: no
commands.short_help: Nopes.
commands.help: Nopes.

commands.name: opendota
commands.short_help: Queries the opendota api
commands.help:
Queries the opendota api

You can use this to get a json file with details about players or matches etc.
Examples:
​`/opendota /players/{steamid}`
​`/opendota /matches/{match_id}`

Note that this is just a little tool showcasing how you can use the api. You can also put urls like these in your browser to get the same results, which I'd recommend if you're doing this a lot.

For more options and a better explanation, check out their [documentation](https://docs.opendota.com)

commands.name: parse
commands.short_help: Requests that OpenDota parses a match
commands.help:
Requests that OpenDota parses a match

The input should be the match_id of the match

Note that matches from more than a couple days ago may not be able to be parsed because replay files are not saved that long

Not giving a matchid will make mangobyte attempt to use your last played match

commands.name: ping
commands.short_help: Pongs a number of times(within reason)
commands.help: Pongs a number of times(within reason)

commands.name: play
commands.short_help: Plays an audio clip
commands.help:
Plays an audio clip

Example:
​`/play hello`

For a complete list of the available clips, try `/playlist`

This can also play other clip types via their ClipID
Example:
​`/play tts:hello there`

commands.name: playerstats
commands.short_help: Gets player match statistics
commands.help:
Gets player match statistics

By default this will target all the matches a player has played.

**Note:** If you're wondering why some data is now missing, check out `/twenty`. I've revamped this command to work for all matches, and `/twenty` is the old version of what this command used to be.

To see how to filter for specific matches, try `/docs matchfilter`

commands.name: playurl
commands.short_help: Plays an mp3 file at a url
commands.help:
Plays an mp3 file at a url

Make sure to use http, not https

commands.name: pokecry
commands.short_help: Plays the pokemon's sound effect
commands.help:
Plays the pokemon's sound effect

Audio files for these pokemon cries were gotten from [Veekun](https://veekun.com/dex/downloads). Veekun does not have the cries for Generation VII yet, so I won't be able to play those.

Most pokemon have a new cry and an old cry. To get the old cry instead of the new one, add 'old' to the end of your command (see example below.)

**Example:**
​`/pokecry pikachu`
​`/pokecry bulbasaur old`

commands.name: pokedex
commands.short_help: Looks up information about the indicated pokemon
commands.help:
Looks up information about the indicated pokemon

Pokemon should be specified using either their name or id number

Clicking on the pokemon's name will bring you to their wiki page

Example:
​`/pokedex charizard`

commands.help:
Displays information about the player's dota profile

The argument for this command can be either a steam32 id, a steam64 id, or an @mention of a discord user who has a steamid set

commands.help: Displays a formatted reddit post

commands.help:

commands.help:

pokemon should be specified using either their name or id number

commands.name: skillbuild
commands.short_help: Gets the ability upgrades for a match
commands.help:
Gets the ability upgrades for a match

Shows all the ability upgrade orders for all heroes in the match

commands.name: smarttts
commands.short_help: Automatically find the best fit for the tts given
commands.help:
Automatically find the best fit for the tts given

First checks local clips (like `/play`), then checks to see if it is an audio url, then checks if it's a dota chatwheel message, then checks if there is an exact match for a dota response clip, and if none of the above is found, does a simple tts clip

commands.name: stop
commands.short_help: Stops the currently playing audio
commands.help:
Stops the currently playing audio

Also empties the clip queue

commands.name: summon
commands.short_help: Summons the bot to the voice channel
commands.help:
Summons the bot to the voice channel

You can specify the specific voice channel that you would like to connect to. If no channel is specified, it will connect to whatever channel you are currently in.
**Examples:**
​`/summon`
​`/summon General`

commands.name: talents
commands.short_help: Gets the talents of a specific hero
commands.help:
Gets the talents of a specific hero

You can give this command almost any variant of the hero's name, or the hero's id, in the same format as `/hero`

**Examples:**
​`/talents shadow fiend`

commands.name: thanks
commands.short_help: Gives thanks
commands.help:
Gives thanks

Thanks are given by a random dota hero in their own special way

commands.name: tts
commands.short_help: Like echo but for people who can't read
commands.help:
Like echo but for people who can't read

Talks in whatever voice channel mangobyte is currently in

Example:
​`/tts Hello I'm a bot`

commands.name: ttsclip
commands.short_help: Tries to text-to-speech the given clip
commands.help:
Tries to text-to-speech the given clip

Only works on clips that have text specified

Example:
​`/ttsclip yodel`

commands.name: twenty
commands.short_help: Gets stats from the player's last 20 parsed games
commands.help:
Gets stats from the player's last 20 parsed games

Note that this only cares about **parsed** games, and unparsed games will be ignored. If the player has less than 20 parsed matches, we'll use all the parsed matches available

To see how to filter for specific matches, try `/docs matchfilter`

commands.name: unsummon
commands.short_help: Removes the bot from the voice channel
commands.help: Removes the bot from the voice channel

commands.name: updateartifact
commands.short_help: Updates all the artifact card data
commands.help: Updates all the artifact card data

commands.name: userconfig
commands.short_help: Configures the bot's user-specific settings
commands.help:
Configures the bot's user-specific settings

Below are the different user-specific settings that you can tweak to customize mangobyte. You can get more information about a setting by typing `/userconfig <settingname>`, and you can configure a setting by typing `/userconfig <settingname> <value>`

**Settings:**
​`steam`
​`intro`
​`outro`
​`introtts`
​`outrotts`
​`dmdotapatch`
​`dmdotablog`

**Examples**
​`/userconfig steam 70388657`
​`/userconfig intro local:math`
​`/userconfig outro dota:troll_warlord_troll_lose_03`
​`/userconfig introtts it's the magnificent`
​`/userconfig outrotts dun gone left`
​`/userconfig dmdotapatch enable`
​`/userconfig dmdotablog enable`

commands.name: whoishere
commands.short_help: Shows what discord users are which steam users
commands.help:
Shows what discord users are which steam users

This command will take the users that are currently in the channel mangobyte is in, and create an embed that shows who they are in steam. If you are in a voice channel, it will use the channel that you are in

You can also mention the users you want to show and it will show those ones too

If you use the word `rank` somewhere in the command, it will also show the ranks of the players

commands.name: wiki
commands.short_help: Looks up a thing on wikipedia
commands.help: Looks up a thing on wikipedia

commands.name: yes
commands.short_help: Oooooh ya.
commands.help: Oooooh ya.
